page.title: 07VILLAGE LIFE IN 1985
page.content: {Elston}and{East Stoke}exemplify the contrast between the old and the more recent style of village life. {East {Stoke}is the type of village that was the norm in the past. People tend to live in the village all their lives; many of them work on the land or around the village and will remain there when they retire. {Elston}is typical of a modern commuter village. Agriculture employs an insignificant fraction of the working population. The recently built housing has resulted in an influx of new people to the village - some retired, but mostly managers, teachers and other professionals employed in nearby towns such as{Newark}and{Nottingham.}These incomers often play an active part in village life, but the village is no longer the centre of peoples' lives as it was in the past.
